Chapter 3 Chapter 1 Linear Equations in Linear Algebra 3.1 Systems of Linear Equations 3.1.1 Linear System 3.1.1.1 Linear System (), Coefficient () and Variable () A linear equation is \[\begin{equation} a_1x_1+a_2x_2+\cdots+a_nx_n=b \qquad n=1, 2, 3, \cdots, \infty \end{equation}\] \(a_1,\dots,a_n\) are real or complex numbers, called {coefficient}.\ \(x_1,\dots,x_n\) are unknown {variables}\ A system of linear equations is called {linear system}.\ knitr::include_app("https://yihui.shinyapps.io/miniUI/", height = "600px") knitr::include_app("https://hemu0626.shinyapps.io/Q_Ch1/", height = "600px")
